channel.title: Need Help on math-measurements
channel.description:
Okay i just wanna know this shit what u need to do is something like this
1.875km=1875m
im not sure about some of the units. i checked google and couldnt find much
i wanna know this
What is one kL in equal to in liters? What is one cL equal to in liters? What is one daL equal to in liters? What is one cg equal to in Kilograms? What is one hg equal to in kilograms? What is one mg equal to in Kilograms? What is one dg equal to in Kilograms? What is one hm equal to in meters? What is one dam equal to in meters?
its a bit, but i have a test and i cant afford to fail.

item.title: Need Help on math-measurements
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

King Henry Doesn’t [Usually] Drink Chocolate Milk

kilo- hecto- deka- [unit] deci- centi- milli-

http://www.purplemath.com/modules/metric.htm

see what 10 seconds of googling can find?

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help on math-measurements
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

It ain’t always kilogram. For instance, you have kilometers wich is 1000 meters.

And this: k is kilo, 1000 (1kg is 1000 kilo’s) was a typo lol, I meant grams not kilo’s.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help on math-measurements
item.dc:creator: @ladylumps69 ladylumps69
item.description:
@ladylumps69 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:3, topic:158583”]k is kilo, 1000 (1kg is 1000 kilo’s)
c is centi, one hundred of 1 (1 centiliter is 0.01 liter)
dont know about da
h is hecto, 100 (1 hm is 100 meter)
m is milli, one thousand of 1 (1 milligram is 0.001 kilo)
d is deci, 10 (1 decimeter is 10 meters)

I hope this helps a bit.[/quote]

‘Kilo’ is just a short version of ‘kilogram’ (1kg) which is 1000 grams, so 1000 kilos would be 1 metric ton (Yes I know I’m nitpicking!)

da will be decalitre which is 10 litres

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help on math-measurements
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

k is kilo, 1000 (1kg is 1000 kilo’s)
c is centi, one hundred of 1 (1 centiliter is 0.01 liter)
dont know about da
h is hecto, 100 (1 hm is 100 meter)
m is milli, one thousand of 1 (1 milligram is 0.001 kilo)
d is deci, 10 (1 decimeter is 10 meters)

I hope this helps a bit.

Read full topic

http://www.google.com/search?q=centigram+to+grams
